thread.title: Alabama NFL roundup: Trio of 100-yard games in Week 7
thread.title_full: Alabama NFL roundup: Trio of 100-yard games in Week 7 | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Alabama NFL roundup: Trio of 100-yard games in Week 7
text:
Oakland Raiders wide receiver Amari Cooper , New Orleans Saints running back Mark Ingram and Jacksonville Jaguars running back T.J. Yeldon turned in 100-yard performances in pacing their teams to victories on Sunday.
Cooper caught five passes for 133 yards and one touchdown in the Raiders' 37-29 victory over the San Diego Chargers. Cooper wrapped up the third 100-yard performance of his six-game NFL career in Oakland's 20-point second quarter. Cooper had four catches for 117 yards in the period, including outjumping San Diego defenders for a 44-yard gain to set up a field goal and running through the Chargers defense with a swing pass for a 52-yard TD.
RELATED: WATCH AMARI COOPER RUN THROUGH CHARGERS DEFENSE FOR 52-YARD TOUCHDOWN
Cooper became the first rookie with three 100-yard receiving games in his team's first six games since Chicago Bears tight end Mike Ditka in 1961. Cooper also joined Randy Moss and Anquan Boldin as the only rookies since the AFL-NFL merger with 500 receiving yards in his team's first six games. Cooper has caught 33 passes for 519 yards and three touchdowns this season.
Ingram had his most productive game of the season in the Saints' 27-21 victory over the Indianapolis Colts. Ingram ran for 143 yards and a touchdown on 14 carries for the sixth 100-yard game of his career and his first since picking up 122 yards against the Pittsburgh Steelers on Nov. 30.
Entering the game, Ingram's longest run of the season was 17 yards. Against the Colts, Ingram broke runs of 44, 35 and 20 yards.
Mark Ingram 1 yard TD run. #NOvsIND #WhoDat pic.twitter.com/tAHtFjQnk1
â€” NFL (@NFLIive) October 25, 2015 Ingram and Khiry Robinson carried the ball 14 times apiece for New Orleans. Robinson gained 28 yards, but he did score two touchdowns, including one on a fake field goal.
After missing Jacksonville's previous game because of a groin injury, Yeldon ran for 115 yards and a touchdown on 20 carries in the Jaguars' 34-31 victory over the Buffalo Bills in London. He also caught a 9-yard pass.
Yeldon turned in the second 100-yard game of his rookie season, joining a 105-yard outing against the Indianapolis Colts on Oct. 4. Yeldon's touchdown was the second of his career, but his first on the ground. The former Daphne High School star found the end zone on a 28-yard run in the second quarter.
RELATED: SEE T.J. YELDON'S FIRST NFL RUSHING TOUCHDOWN
Yeldon might have had another score, but on Jacksonville's first possession of the second half, the Jaguars gave the ball to Toby Gerhart for four straight no-gain carries after having first-and-goal at the Buffalo 1. Yeldon had carried the ball seven times for 42 yards in Jacksonville's march to the 1.
Cooper, Ingram and Yeldon were among the 19 former Alabama players who got on the field on the seventh Sunday of the NFL's 2015 season.
Other former Alabama players who started on Sunday included wide receiver Julio Jones of the Atlanta Falcons, defensive tackle Marcell Dareus and right offensive tackle Cyrus Kouandjio of the Bills, strong safety Roman Harper of the Carolina Panthers, middle linebacker Rolando McClain of the Dallas Cowboys, linebacker Dont'a Hightower of the New England Patriots, free safety Landon Collins of the New York Giants, left guard James Carpenter of the New York Jets, outside linebacker Mark Barron of the St. Louis Rams and right guard Chance Warmack of the Tennessee Titans.
Jones scored the only touchdown in the Falcons' 10-7 victory over the Titans on an 8-yard reception with 5:56 left in the third quarter. Jones caught nine passes for 92 yards in the game.
RELATED: JULIO JONES CAN BE 'GREATEST PLAYER EVER,' FORMER TEAMMATE SAYS
Kouandjio's start was the first of his NFL career.
Hightower suffered a rib injury in New England's victory over Dallas on Oct. 11 and missed last week's game. He returned to make 10 tackles and recover a fumble in the Patriots' 30-23 victory over the Jets.
Barron was an All-American safety at Alabama and that's been his position in the NFL. The Rams have used him in a variety of schemes since obtaining the former St. Paul's star in a trade last year. Because of injuries, Barron started at outside linebacker for the first time in St. Louis' 24-6 victory over the Cleveland Browns, and he came through with 16 tackles, including two behind the line of scrimmage, in his new spot.
Other former Alabama players seeing action on Sunday included Jaguars long snapper Carson Tinker, Minnesota Vikings offensive tackle Austin Shepherd, Patriots tight end Michael Williams, Titans fullback Jalston Fowler and Washington Redskins guard Arie Kouandjio.
Williams caught a 4-yard pass in the Patriots' victory over the Jets.
Panthers wide receiver Kevin Norwood, Houston Texans cornerback Kareem Jackson and defensive end Jeoffrey Pagan and Eagles linebacker DeMeco Ryans were designated as inactive. Jackson suffered an ankle injury and Ryans suffered a hamstring injury in their previous games.
FOR MORE OF AL.COM'S COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE NFL, GO TO OUR NFL PAGE
The Chicago Bears, Cincinnati Bengals, Denver Broncos and Green Bay Packers were on their bye weeks.
The seventh week of the NFL season concludes with the Baltimore Ravens visiting the Arizona Cardinals at 7:30 p.m. CDT Monday. ESPN will televise the game.
